definition: school begins/give a course/teach a subject

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The first two weeks of the course are referred to as "Transition."
sentences.chinese: 开课的前两周可称为“过渡期”。

sentences.english: His office hours were irregular and sometimes held on a> mountaintop.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作时数不合法，有时是在山巅开课。

sentences.english: Three large-scale Chinese campsites' open classes and several camping industry summits are held.
sentences.chinese: 三场大型中国露营地公开课以及多场行业峰会论坛。

sentences.english: The Yantai Oriental cherry Japanese School new class evening class teaches a course, welcome to deign to inquire.
sentences.chinese: 烟台樱花日语学校新班晚班开课啦，欢迎垂询。

sentences.english: The class times and course curriculum are flexible, and will be designed in response to requests from participants.
sentences.chinese: 开课时间及课程将广泛征求参与者意见。

sentences.english: The final course the students take then is the Capstone project, which happens over the summer.
sentences.chinese: 最后要修的一门课是总结性课程，开课时间是夏季。

sentences.english: Intermediate and Intermediate High Levels will be available, starting from the summer 2006.
sentences.chinese: 华语中级及中高级班将于夏季陆续开课。

sentences.english: But it's really good. I'll probably keep doing Open Course Ware stuff like, for fun,
sentences.chinese: 但是这很好。我可能会一直为了好玩上公开课，

sentences.english: He earned a lot of extra income for himself by taking classes on the side.
sentences.chinese: 同时，通过开课讲学，他还会有额外的收入。

sentences.english: Enrolment deadline is 5 calendar days before the course commencement date.
sentences.chinese: 各课程的截止报名日期为开课前的五日。

sentences.english: End date for registration: three weeks before the starting date.
sentences.chinese: 开课日期的前三周为报名截止日。

sentences.english: The success of the program requires that the locations of the courses be accessible to the club members.
sentences.chinese: 该计划的成功与否端赖开课的地点是否靠近社员。

sentences.english: The specific semester will be decided upon when your application form is submitted.
sentences.chinese: 每学期的具体开课时间会在您提交申请表的时候告知。

sentences.english: So the short answer is this, class will begin next year in the current plan.
sentences.chinese: 因此简单地说，从现在的计划来看，明年应该会开课。

sentences.english: So here's the question we started the class off with.
sentences.chinese: 现在回到我们一开课提出的那个问题。

sentences.english: Start from 13th February, one week one accessory, continuous 10 weeks to share new ideas with you.
sentences.chinese: 日开课，连续十周教授手饰与配件的制作。

definition: to begin a lecture/to start on a story
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
tutorial/period of tuition for one or two students
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
